author: Israel Ojoko
title: Uganda's Speaker Anita Among Commits to Resolving Nubian Community Concerns
text:
Speaker of Parliament, Anita Among, has pledged to address concerns of the Nubian community by encouraging them to submit a comprehensive petition through their Member of Parliament. She assured that issues falling within the Parliament's jurisdiction will be handled effectively. Government Chief Whip, Hon Hamson Obua, also expressed support for addressing the community's issues. The Nubian community leaders appreciated the opportunity to present their concerns and are optimistic about a positive resolution.
In a significant move towards inclusivity and support for minority communities, Speaker Anita Among assured the Nubian community leaders of Parliament's commitment to resolving their longstanding issues. During a meeting held on Thursday, 29 February 2024, Among emphasized the importance of submitting a formal petition through their area Member of Parliament, Hon Hassan Kirumira. This approach aims to ensure that the concerns are addressed comprehensively and systematically within the legislative framework.
Government's Supportive Stance
Adding to the Speaker's commitment, Government Chief Whip, Hon Hamson Obua, reiterated the government's readiness to support the Nubian community's efforts to address their issues. The government acknowledges the challenges faced by the community and promises to consult and find the best solutions to strategic concerns. This collaborative effort between the government and the Parliament underscores a unified approach to tackling the issues raised by the Nubian leaders.
The Nubian community leaders, led by Mr. Twaha Hassan, expressed their gratitude towards Speaker Among for the audience and the assurance of addressing their concerns. The leaders' optimism is palpable, as they look forward to a positive resolution that will see the implementation of community projects, including schools, hospitals, and other essential amenities. This meeting marks a significant step towards fostering a sense of belonging and support for the Nubian community in Uganda.
The commitment from Uganda's Parliament and government to address the concerns of the Nubian community is a notable development in the nation's approach to minority issues. With the formulation and submission of a comprehensive petition, there is a hopeful anticipation for impactful changes that will enhance the welfare and inclusion of the Nubian community within Ugandan society.
